intro: Weinmannia pullei, commonly known as the Hawaiian weinmannia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forests and rocky areas. It has a woody stem and can reach heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
